CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper October 8, 1960, pg. 34, reads: "Old House Made New - On hand to observe the almost-miraculous transformation of a 57-year-old Homewood house to one apparently constructed new from the cellar to the top were, front row, left to right: Elroy Face, outstanding major league pitcher of the Pittsburgh Pirates, shown congratulating Pittsburgh's Mayor Joseph M. Barr, who received the gold key to the 'Renaissance House,' and top row: Robert Loudman and Melvin Levine, vice present and president, respectively, of Amber Lumber Company. The lumber company remodeled the home at 7657 Baxter St., in a project co-sponsored by ACTION-Housing, Inc., and Life magazine - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Pittsburgh Pirates baseball player Elroy Face shaking hands with Pittsburgh Mayor Joseph M. Barr holding large key, with Robert Loudman and Melvin Levine standing behind them on steps of newly remodeled house, 7657 Baxter Street, Homewood
